Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style or Mature Animal Style pottery kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower in added white outline with trace of added red centres, above two white lines; exterior: black-figure decoration (fired red) consisting of part of sphinx (face, lower part of legs and tail lost) to left; incised rosette as filling ornament; base line and part of lower frieze below.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in Group B of the Sphinx and Lion Style; this is not a very coherent group, but the animals depicted all have elongated bodies and the rosettes have a daisy shape. The cup and kantharos are not typical forms of the Sphinx and Lion Style. Contemporary with the Sphinx and Lion Style is the Mature Animal Style in which cups (but not kantharoi) are more common. Type A kantharoi are contemporary with both styles. Incision is not found on vases of the Mature Animal Style or on Type A kantharoi, but the subject matter and filling ornament on this sherd are very typical of both the Mature Animal Style and that found on Type A kantharoi. This kantharos, one of only a few decorated pieces, appears to be influenced by both styles. For another example, see British Museum 1965,0930.305.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 147, p. 149, fig. 82, p. 322, no. 1444, pl. 192)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1645) (phase 2)
